subject: JUnit works great in IDE, how do I run it from a shell?
msgSnippet: I ve had great luck with NB 5.0 and junit on my project. But the output goes to the statistics window and that can t be cut and pasted using normal X
messageBody:
I've had great luck with NB 5.0 and junit on my project.
But the output goes to the 'statistics' window
and that can't be cut and pasted using normal X conventions.
(I'm running it on a Mandrivia 2006 box with JRE 5.0)

I'd really love to be able to pipe the output of the
statistics page so I can send the great results off
the my pointy haired bosses.

I've connected to my project's main directory, where the
build.xml is (and above the nbproject directories)

ant test
and nearly anything else I can try gets a long message
from ant

starting out with


BUILD FAILED
/home/pfarrell/aframe/sandbox/src/server/AFrameLib/nbproject/build-impl.xml:459:
The following error occurred while executing this line:
/home/pfarrell/aframe/sandbox/src/server/AFrameLib/nbproject/build-impl.xml:140:
Could not create task or type of type: junit.

Ant could not find the task or a class this task relies upon.

This is common and has a number of causes; the usual
solutions are to read the manual pages then download and
install needed JAR files, or fix the build file:
- You have misspelt 'junit'.


[snip]

Any clues?

thanks
Pat
--
Pat Farrell
http://www.pfarrell.com/
